Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel - Not for Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: nicoleonholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Nuevo Madrid. It is not too far from the airport. The staff were nice - spoke quite good english and one girl in reception was very helpful and was happy to show us how to get into the CBD and to the metro etc - we really apprecaited that. The hotel was clean and modern. The hotel WIFI was very good. Unfortunatley the Restaurant was closed, which was disapointing considering it is High Season, no restaurants around unless you take a taxi. Good as a business hotel, not for pleasure. Overall pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel at a very competitive price”
Reviews.Author: nuriaar
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid with a family member and stayed at this hotel since it was very close to the M30 road. If you go to Madrid by train you can get the tube at Atocha station to Pio XII or Pinar de Chamartin. The hotel is very nice and the prices are really good for a 4 star-hotel (53 euros/night/double room). Also, the price includes an hour spa-session... though I thought that the spa was more like a big bath... and I didn't fancy sharing a bath with a guy I didn't know... Besides that, the hotel is worth it if you want to spend a weekend in Madrid. PS: Pio XII tube is more or less 20 minutes away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiran J
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and what can I say! The worst hotel I have ever stayed in! The staff are considerably rude!! They understood English and they were still rude! We also paid for a city view room and that was not what we got. We asked for twin beds and we only got one duvet. Our hairdryer ACTUALLY blew up so we had to wait for another one. When that one arrived we had to install it ourselves! the bath tab leaks, and I mean everywhere. Our beds were not even changed for the whole 3 nights we were there, all they did was tidy up, but not changed the sheets. When we left they tried to charge us for food and drinks out of the mini bar that we didnt even know our room had! it was just terrible. The restaurant didnt open until 9pm and we didnt know so when we went to the restauarant at 8pm we were told to "come back later were busy!" What time do you open? "9pm it says so outside!!!" they were just rude! When we left to go back home no one was nice enough to say goodbye to us. And do not be fooled by the free internet they offer. We got free wifi for one night only and then they cut it off for the rest of our stay. Just a waste of money staying here and never again will we be visiting this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for conferences, not located for leisure”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Nuevo recently for a work conference. It's certainly not near anything at all, not a shop, cafe or metro station within walking distance, so I'd imagine this would only be a hotel for business events. The lobby is spacious and modern, but coming from Australia I arrived the day before my European colleagues, and it was like a ghost town - it reminded me of the Fatboy Slim music video with Christopher Walken dancing around an abandoned hotel lobby! The rooms are a decent size and comfortable, although the beds are rock hard - a complaint amongst all attendees. The shower was a also a mere dribble as well, which I always find hugely disappointing (having said that, a colleague staying on another floor said his was great) Breakfast was pretty decent, with the full offering, and the lady greeting everyone each morning was so lovely and happy, made my morning each day to come to breakfast! The conference facilities were quite good, we had around 160 of us in a big room and then multiple break-out sessions, and it handled it well. The hotel staff were there every 30 mins or so with fresh coffee and pastries to keep up our stamina! A good hotel for a conference in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money at a reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: conchinha
Reviews.Content: rooms would need some facelifting when compared to the hotel entrance. but the room size is very satisfactory. location is very good if you want to be far enough from centre, and close enough to metro (maximum 1.5km) or highway. price was perfect for 4 stars hotel. would return on next time.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD EXPERIENCE OF MADRID”
Reviews.Author: ashokesinha2001
Reviews.Content: I was in Hotel Nuevo Madrid during 15th April midnight to 17th April afternoon 2011. An Excellent Hotel with affordable cost. Air port to Hotel taxi cost EU-23 only City to Hotel taxi cost EU-16 only Best wishes to all. Dr. A. K. Sinha. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but...................”
Reviews.Author: stphnmcgwn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean and generally a nice hotel for business travel. I guess the hotel would be OK if you are attending a conference there but it is not close to Madrid centre so, if you want to do anything in the evening, you need to drive or take a taxi. Taxi's struggled to find the hotel. No alarm clock in the room. I ordered a wake up call on my first night and am still waiting for it. On complaining at reception, I was greeted with sneers. The doormen are friendly but they are the only staff who are. If you have limited Spanish, don't expect to be able to receive help - I've travelled to Madrid numerous times for business and this is the only hotel where I've found that staff cannot speak English. No ironing board available - given that this is a business hotel, I expected to be able to at least iron a shirt for work. Overall, nice hotel but would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Madrid”
Reviews.Author: anwaar_farooqi
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel Good clean rooms Nice bathroom amenities The hotel is a bit far away from the centre of Madrid Very good conference facilities

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too far ....”
Reviews.Author: motheroftwoTampa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice for business not for pleasure ...tooooo far from everything. Do not get room that faces expressway ... very safe area but isolated from everything...we had to walk for about 10min to a bus stop then had to switch buses to get to El Prado ..staff ..a little to stuffy ....It is renovated , very modern and sharp but you can hear everything that is going on in the next room. Matresses not comfortable at all .....They should have use the renovation money on the mattresses and not on the fancy loobby !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel, Staff very helpful, Clean”
Reviews.Author: robert-not-home
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days at this hotel on a business trip. The hotel is clean (the carpets are a bit worn), bathrooms spotless. The breakfast buffet was large and quite good. Options included cereals, eggs, meats, fruits, several juices, yogurt, breads, sweets, and more As I was there over a weekend I did some site seeing. The front desk staff was very helpful in arranging these tours (through trapsatur). As others mentioned this hotel is not in the heart of Madrid and a taxi ride to the center will cost about 15 Euros. It was close to my office so for my needs it was well situated. The rooms were quiet, although if someone slammed their door you could hear it. The fitness center is decent, 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical, 2 bikes and a weight machine. It officially opens at 8am, but they will open it early for you if you ask at the front desk. The only issue I had was I found my room (and the fitness center) to be a bit warm. I was there in late October so it was not hot outside, but I just could not get my room to cool down. I do like it cool so for others this may be a non-issue. The fitness center abuts the Sauna so I suspect that is why it was warm. The free in room WiFi / Internet is a nice bonus. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, but a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: A modern, clean, almost sterile business hotel located quite away outside the centre of Madrid, but convenient for several large companies including my own. Clean, functional, comfortable rooms, good bathrooms, a great breakfast and a nice beer in the bar. Pretty much everything you would expect from a hotel you were using during a business trip. It's major drawback though is its isolation from local facilities, as there are no decent restaurants or bars in walking distance. I hate eating in hotels, so resent being forced to do so if there is nothing else local. I'd stay there again without hesitation, but need to bear in mind the amount I spend on taxis or the distance I have to walk to get dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: LLanes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for four nights this month of march. The first night They gave me a single room which was incredibly small, be aware all the single rooms they have are this big, and it is not worth the money: I complained to the reception desk, telling then that it was just not acceptable for a four star hotel and for the rate I was paying, They promised me that the following nigt they could arrange a double room paying an extra fee, which I accepted it anyway I told them to transmit my concerns about the room to the management and I din´t received a response during the for nights I have stayed there so in terms of customer care I give this hotel a 0. Breakfast is one of the worst I have had in a four star hotel, the selection of hot food is very limited and inedible, orange juice is very bad, and the pastrys are rockhard, unfortunaley because the hotel is in the midle of nowhere (if you don´t have a car you wiil spend a fortune in taxis) this is your only choice for breakfast. TV´s are nice flat screen but the picture quality is very poor. They have a nice coffe lounge, but don´t expect the waiters to come to ask you if you want to drink something, youi have to chase the, unacceptable for a four star hote. There a lot of better choices in Madrid specially in terms of location and customer care-.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel - not a good pick for tourists”
Reviews.Author: ordflyer
Reviews.Content: The Husa Neuvo Madrid a 4 star (I presume) hotel is located in the middle of a residential section of Madrid. It is a fairly modern hotel and as a four star hotel goes....is about middle of the road. The bar in the lobby is a bit small, but the prices were reasonable compared to other hotel bars. My room was simple, clean and functional. The breakfast buffet was fairly broad in selection, and having been included in the rate, I don't have a feel as to whether it was expensive or not. My booking was less than 100 euros per night, in my opinion, giving this property a very reasonable value proposition. The free internet was an added bonus, and since European hotels typically charge a fortune for this service, this was a pleasant surprise. I stayed here for work, and this hotel does a good job for that purpose. I would not recommend this to a tourist as it is out of the way, and there is nothing nearby that one can easily walk to to experience Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Dodge”
Reviews.Author: Merrimack2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, it was a wonderful opportunity to get away from the tourist trap and preview a bit of normal life. The hotel is situated in a very safe upper class neighborhood. The hotel itself is modern with all the amenities you would have in an American/Canadian hotel. Only a few issues if you speak Spanish like myself you will be fine, but I hear it might be difficult if you speak another language. Also be willing to walk a long way to reach the metro (15-20 min walk) and or learn to utilize the public bus system, the 107 takes you right to the Plaza de Castilla Metro stop which will lead you to all parts of the city. Make sure when describing were the hotel is located to a Taxi driver that they know its near Avenida Arturo Soria. This hotel is primarily a business hotel but I think the modern amenities were well worth it, and while some of the staff may appear to be snobby they will warm up as you get to know them.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel, not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: jenster
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here as my husband had a meeting in one of the business parks nearby, but the remaining three days we had in Madrid were spoiled by the poor location of this hotel. Admittedly we knew it was going to be far out, but the hotel website's claim of being 1km from two different Metro stations led us to believe it would be fairly reachable. Sure it's probably 1km to either station as the crow flies, but the bus took about 10 minutes so I dread to think how long walking would have taken. The hotel is situated on a new road which is basically a building site, and unknown to most Madrid taxi drivers. The windows are soundproofed to the outside motorway, but unsurprisingly they couldn't fix the view! Unfortunately the rooms were not soundproof to noise inside the hotel, I could hear my daughter just laughing all the way from the lift so I think we were probably disturbing a few others in the nearby rooms. The flatscreen tvs also have a volume limit which is probably a good thing but it's annoying when you can't hear it yourself. We were also quite surprised to see the poor state of the bathroom, considering that it was only built 18 months ago. The quality of the tilework and seal finishing was equal to something you'd see in a backwater two star place. It was also quite a contrast to the well furnished bedroom and design reception. There was also no information book in the room, and when I asked at reception they thought I was crazy for wanting to know about breakfast times, internet access, local info etc. The tv had been set up for the job but each page just had 'under construction' which was no help. Breakfast by the way was a buffet, which at 14 euros was not really worth the effort. All in all this hotel was OK, but I certainly wouldn't recommend it for tourists. Taxis to the nearby business areas are just a few euros from the centre and very easy to find. My final tip - very few people in Madrid seem to speak English so if you don't know any Spanish try to learn a few basics before you go.
